column2: ENGLISH
Call for a Levy Tax

While no formal system of taxation truly exists in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], the reigning [Root.GetTitle] is permitted to levy the wealth of [Root.GetHersHis] vassals once every year. However, it is ultimately up to each vassal whether or not to honour the request.
Study the English Classics
Take some time to peruse the Royal Archive of Avalon.
Organize a Coronation Ceremony
Begin preparation for my Coronation Ceremony. As a [Root.GetTitle] of the Eternal Way, it is imperative for me to be neofeudal_crowned by the clergy in order to legitimize my divine right to rule.
column3: Commencer les préparatifs de votre cérémonie de couronnement. Puisque je suis un[Root.Get_E] [Root.GetTitle] [Root.GetReligionMascFem], il est impératif que je sois couronné[Root.Get_E] par un éminent membre du clergé afin de légitimer mon droit divin à régner.
column4: Fangt mit den Vorbereitungen für eine Krönungszeremonie an. Als [Root.Religion.GetName]e[Root.GetrMale] [Root.GetTitle] ist es unbedingt erforderlich, dass ich von einem angesehenen Mitglied des Klerus gekrönt werde, um mein gottgegebenes Recht auf Herrschaft zu legitimieren.
column6: Comienzo a preparar mi ceremonia de coronación. Como [Root.GetTitle] [Root.Religion.GetName] es fundamental que un miembro distinguido de la Iglesia me corone para legitimar mi derecho divino a reinar.

column2: You are preparing to request funds from the many subjects of your realm. You can only do this once per year.

TO: [Root.GetTitledName]
FROM: [From.GetTitledName]
RE: A Levy Tax
We, in accordance with established law and oath in our fair realm of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], request a contribution to the treasury for the next year.
Send 10% of our annual income.
Send 20% of our annual income.
Send 30% of our annual income.
Politely decline our sovereign's request.

Your deeds in the latest engagement have not gone unnoticed. With the recommendation of your squadron and immediate superiors, [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] Majesty has bestowed you with a 'life knighthood'. While not hereditary as in the case of a landed title of nobility, holders of life knighthoods are considered equal in prestige and, among certain circles, arguably superior to their unblooded peers.

Your deeds in the latest engagement have won acclaim from the lords, knights, and men-at-arms of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] fleet, with those assembled proclaiming you Knight-[Root.GetTitle]. It seems the concept of the warrior-sovereign is not so archaic as once thought.
Indeed.

With each martial exploit, the star of your fame climbs higher and higher. This reputation is not limited to just the home stars, with enemy captains and pilots across known space either dreading your presence or relishing a chance to put your reputation to the test. Perhaps in time, you will be counted among the greatest knights in human history.
Perhaps.

The foes of the realm tremble at the mere possibility of your presence in battle, and your life has become the stuff of songs and poetry. Every return home is greeted with a parade, and you have won more medals than you know what to do with. Some even compare you to the most noble of Terra's ancient heroes: the Nine Worthies. Few, alive or dead, could even think of claiming this honour.
Truly, I am without equal.
I have fulfilled my duties, and nothing more.

Your prowess in battle is truly unmatched, and your renown has reached legendary levels. Many consider would consider you an equal of, if not superior to, the Nine Worthies. You could rightfully be called the Tenth Worthy.
I am the greatest of all.
I am sure there are many who are better than me.

The Kingdom of Avalon is young, but its heritage is ancient and great. So as to maintain this cultural continuity, efforts have been made to collect the great works of the old English in the Royal Archives. I should delve into this collection, that I may learn from those who came before.
The Comedies, Histories, and Tragedies of the Bard sound most fascinating.
I will study the great epic of the ages, called the Legendarium.
The oldest work of English literature: Beowulf.
I would like to know more of ancient monarchs and how they ruled.

I did what I could, but my attempts to study the work of the ancients has not proven fruitful. The material is there and time is available, I simply lack the enthusiasm to continue. What little I did manage to engage with in these past months has not taught me much, if at all.
What a pity.

In these past months I have immersed myself in the collected works of William Shakespeare, also known as the Bard of Avon. It has been an enlightening learning experience, and your newfound grasp of poetry has proven a hit with the court.
My studies have paid off.

In these past months I have immersed myself in the compiled Legendarium, the national epic of the ancient English. Reading the accounts of the First Age and of the Noldor in particular has been an enthralling experience for me.
In these past months I have immersed myself in the oldest work of English literature, recounting the life of the great Hero-King Beowulf.

The legitimacy of a ruler ultimately stems from [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], and therefore it is of paramount importance for a monarch to obtain divine sanction for their rule. To do this, you must crown yourself as soon as possible, lest your vassals cease to recognize your authority altogether.
Unfortunate
Now that I have found an [Root.Religion.GetName] priest willing to crown me and made all the necessary preparations, I must decide how much I wish to spend on the ceremony leading up to it.
column3: Maintenant que j'ai trouvé un prêtre [Root.GetReligionMasc] pour officier à mon couronnement, je dois décider combien je souhaite dépenser pour la cérémonie.
column4: Jetzt, wo ich einen [Root.Religion.GetName]en Priester gefunden habe, der bereit ist mich zu krönen, muss ich entscheiden, wie viel ich für die Zeremonie ausgeben möchte.
column6: Ahora que he encontrado un sacerdote dispuesto a coronarme, debo decidir cuánto deseo gastar en la ceremonia en sí.

column2: Now that I have found a distinguished member of the [Root.Religion.GetName] clergy to officiate the rites and made all the necessary preparations, it is time to organize the ceremony itself. Unfortunately, the necessities imposed by the war I am waging will force me to have only a small gathering of my closest allies to witness this momentous occasion.
column3: Puisque j'ai trouvé un membre éminent du clergé catholique pour officier dans les rites, il est temps d'organiser la cérémonie. Malheureusement, les nécessités imposées par la guerre que je mène me contraindront à n'avoir qu'un petit rassemblement de mes plus proches alliés pour assister à cette occasion mémorable.
column4: Jetzt, wo ich ein angesehenes Mitglied des katholischen Klerus gefunden habe, das die Krönung leitet, ist es an der Zeit die Zeremonie selbst zu organisieren. Leider zwingt mich die Notwendigkeit, die mir der Krieg aufgelegt hat, nur zu einer kleinen Versammlung meiner engsten Verbündeten, um diese wichtige Gelegenheit mitzuerleben.
column6: Ahora que he encontrado un miembro distinguido del clero católico para que celebre los ritos, es hora de organizar la ceremonia en sí. Por desgracia, las necesidades impuestas por la guerra que estoy librando me obligarán a tener solamente una pequeña reunión de mis aliados más cercanos como testigos de esta ocasión memorable.

column2: It shall be an extravagant ceremony.
column4: Es soll eine extravagante Zeremonie sein.

column2: A dignified ceremony will do.
column6: Bastará con una ceremonia digna ceremonia.

column2: I will have a private ceremony.
column4: Ich werde eine private Zeremonie abhalten.

column2: It is what it is...

Only a few more days remain before I am neofeudal_crowned [Root.GetTitle] before [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and all my subjects. Such a lavish ceremony is a rare spectacle to behold even amongst royalty.
column3: Plus que quelques jours avant d'être consacré[Root.Get_E] [Root.GetTitle] devant [Root.Get_le_HighGod] et tous mes sujets. Ma cour est déjà remplie de vassaux et de dignitaires étrangers venus assister à ce moment fondamental de mon règne. Une cérémonie si somptueuse est un spectacle rare, même pour la royauté.
column4: Es bleiben nur ein paar Tage bevor ich [Root.Getzumzur] [Root.GetTitle] vor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] und all meinen Untertanen gekrönt werde. Mein Hof ist bereits mit all meinen vornehmen Gästen gefüllt und all meine Vasallen und ausländischen Würdenträger sind gekommen, um diesen wichtigen Moment zu bezeugen. Eine solch prunkvolle Zeremonie ist ein seltenes Spektakel, das nur Königen vorenthalten ist.
column6: Faltan pocos días para que me coronen [Root.GetTitle] ante [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] y todos mis súbditos. La corte ya está llena con mis distinguidos invitados. Vasallos y dignatarios extranjeros han venido para ser testigos de este momento fundamental de mi reinado. Una ceremonia tan espléndida con tantos invitados de prestigio no es un espectáculo muy común ni para la realeza.

column2: The time of my coronation draws near: only a few more days before I am crowned [Root.GetTitle] before [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and all my subjects. My court has been already filled with all the vassals of my realm who have come to bear witness to this fundamental moment of my reign.
column3: Plus que quelques jours avant d'être consacré[Root.Get_E] [Root.GetTitle] devant Dieu et tous mes sujets. Ma cour est déjà remplie de vassaux de mon pays venus assister à ce moment fondamental de mon règne.
column4: Die Zeit meiner Krönung rückt näher. Es sind nur noch ein paar Tage, bis ich vor Gott und all meinen Vasallen [Root.Getzumzur] [Root.GetTitle] gekrönt werde. Mein Hof ist bereits mit allen Vasallen meines Reiches gefüllt, die Zeuge dieses wichtigen Moments meiner Herrschaft sind.
column6: La hora de la coronación se acerca. Unos días más y me coronarán [Root.GetTitle] ante Dios y todos mis súbditos. Mi corte ya está llena con todos los vasallos de mi reino que han venido a ser testigos de este momento fundamental de mi reinado.

column2: The time of my coronation draws near: only a few more days before I am crowned [Root.GetTitle] before [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and all my subjects. It will be a long wait with very little to do, but I hope at least that this period of seclusion will give me time to ponder upon my future responsibilities as [Root.GetTitle].
column3: Plus que quelques jours avant d'être consacré[Root.Get_E] [Root.GetTitle] devant Dieu et tous mes sujets. Cela va être une longue attente avec très peu de choses à faire, mais j'espère au moins que cette période de réclusion me donnera le temps de réfléchir à mes futures responsabilités en tant qu[Root.Get_only_e_Title][Root.GetTitle].
column4: Die Zeit meiner Krönung rückt näher. Es sind nur noch ein paar Tage, bis ich vor Gott und all meinen Vasallen [Root.Getzumzur] [Root.GetTitle] gekrönt werde. Es wird eine lange Wartezeit sein, mit nur sehr wenig zu tun, aber ich hoffe zumindest, dass diese Zeit der Abgeschiedenheit mit Zeit gibt, über meine zukünftige Verantwortung als [Root.GetTitle] nachzudenken.
column6: La hora de la coronación se acerca. Unos días más y me coronarán [Root.GetTitle] ante Dios y todos mis súbditos. Será una larga espera con poco que hacer, pero espero que al menos este periodo de aislamiento me dé tiempo para reflexionar sobre mis futuras responsabilidades como [Root.GetTitle].

column2: The time of my coronation draws near: only a few more days before I am crowned [Root.GetTitle] before [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and all my subjects. It will be a long wait and I can only hope that the day will not fall in the middle of a major battle...
column3: Il ne reste plus que quelques jours avant que je ne sois consacré[Root.Get_E] [Root.GetTitle] devant Dieu et tous mes sujets. Ce sera une longue attente et j'espère que ce jour n'arrivera pas au beau milieu d'une bataille majeure...
column4: Die Zeit meiner Krönung ist nahe. Es sind nur noch ein paar Tage, bis ich vor Gott und allen meinen Untertanen [Root.Getzumzur] [Root.GetTitle] gekrönt werden. Es wird eine lange Zeit des Wartens und ich kann nur hoffen, dass der Tag nicht inmitten einer großen Schlacht fallen wird...
column6: La hora de mi coronación se hacer: solo quedan unos días para que me coronen [Root.GetTitle] ante Dios y mis súbditos. Será una espera larga, espero no caer en una gran batalla…

column2: It will never be soon enough.
column3: Ce ne sera jamais assez tôt.
column4: Es kann gar nicht schnell genug gehen.

column2: Coronation of [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName]

I kneel before the priest as a host of vassals surrounds us in complete silence. The priest blesses me and places the crown upon my head, proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Je m'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de vassaux nous entourent dans un silence complet. [coronation_priest.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] me bénit, place la couronne sur ma tête et me proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: Ich kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. [coronation_priest.GetDerDie] [coronation_priest.GetTitle] segnete mich, setzte die Krone auf mein Haupt und verkündete durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] meine Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
column6: Me arrodillo ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos nos rodea en un silencio absoluto. [coronation_priest.GetElLaCap] [coronation_priest.GetTitle] me bendice y me pone la corona en la cabeza, proclamándome [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: I kneel before the priest with all my reverently silent vassals surrounding us. The priest gives me an encouraging smile as he blesses me and places the Royal Crown upon my head as I feel my face turning red. He then proclaims me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Je m'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors que tous mes vassaux nous entourent dans un silence complet. [coronation_priest.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] me fait un sourire encourageant, me bénit et place la couronne royale sur ma tête, tandis que je sens que je rougis. Puis, [coronation_priest.GetIlElle] me proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce de Dieu.
column4: Ich kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. [coronation_priest.GetDerDie] [coronation_priest.GetTitle] schenkte mir noch ein ermutigendes Lächeln, als [coronation_priest.GetSheHe] mich segnete und die Krone auf mein Haupt legte. Ich fühlte wie mein Gesicht rot wurde. Anschließend verkündete He meine Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] durch die Gnade Gottes.
column6: Me arrodillo ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras todos mis vasallos nos rodean en un silencio absoluto. [coronation_priest.GetElLaCap] [coronation_priest.GetTitle] me da una sonrisa de ánimo al bendecirme y ponerme la corona real en la cabeza mientras enrojezco. Después me proclama [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de Dios.

column2: I kneel before the priest in the empty hall of my palace and, after a quick blessing, the priest summarily and places the crown upon my head, proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Je m'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] dans la grande salle vide de mon palais et, après une rapide bénédiction, [coronation_priest.Get_only_le_Title][coronation_priest.GetTitle] me bénit, place sommairement la couronne sur ma tête et me proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: Ich kniete in der leeren Halle meines Palastes vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] nieder und nach einem kurzen Segen setzte [coronation_priest.Getderdie] [coronation_priest.GetTitle] kurzerhand die Krone auf meinen Kopf und krönte mich durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
column6: Me arrodillo ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] en un salón vacío de palacio y tras una bendición rápida, el the priest me pone precipitadamente la corona en la cabeza, proclamándome [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: As the sounds of explosions and laser fire echo throughout the cabin, the priest utters a brief prayer and summarily places the crown upon my head. A stray piece of debris hits the hull, violently shaking the ship and throwing everyone towards the side. Scrambling to his feet, the priest quickly proclaims me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Tandis que les cris des commandants qui ordonnent aux troupes résonnent sous la tente, [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] me donne une bénédiction rapide et place sommairement la couronne sur ma tête, me proclamant [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce de Dieu.
column4: Als die Schreie der Kommandanten, die die Truppen drillen, in meinem Zelt wiederhalte, gab mir [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] einen schnellen Segen, legte die Krone auf meinen Kopf und krönte mich [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] unter der Gnade Gottes.
column6: Mientras los gritos de los comandantes realizando la instrucción resuenan en la tienda, [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] me da una bendición rápida y me coloca velozmente la corona en la cabeza, proclamándome [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de Dios.

column2: My rule shall be a just one.
Knight
This character has won a knighthood by the sword, and has been ennobled if previously of common birth.
Gallant
This character is a rising star in both the noble courts and battlefields of the known galaxy, attracting equal amounts of admiration and fear.
Worthy
This character is revered far and wide as a modern pinnacle of chivalry and martial prowess, standing abreast with the Nine Worthies of ancient Terra.
Uncrowned
This character has not been officialy coronated, hurting their legitimacy.
Crowned
This character has been coronated, as befits a [Root.GetTitle].
You take some time to study the works of the Ancient English
Focus your studies on classics of poetry and theatre.
Focus your studies on the great national epic.
Focus your studies on the oldest work of English literature.
This may be the path to ideas other Neo-Feudalists find disagreeable.
Begin preparing for a coronation.
